intro: Achyronia verrucosa, commonly known as the warty achyronia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive warty leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in small, raised bumps, giving them a textured appearance. The flowers are clustered in racemes and are pollinated primarily by insects.
